meanings.definition: The Korean alphabet, consisting of 24 letters.
meanings.sent1: Learning hangul is important for understanding Korean.
meanings.sent2: She wrote her name in hangul on the paper.
meanings.sent3: The hangul letters danced across the page.
meanings.sent4: His love for hangul was as clear as day.
meanings.sent5: The beauty of hangul captivated her.

meanings.definition: The script in which the Korean language is written.
meanings.sent1: The book was written in hangul, making it easy for her to read.
meanings.sent2: He practiced his handwriting in hangul every day.
meanings.sent3: The hangul script whispered secrets to those who could read it.
meanings.sent4: Her words in hangul painted a vivid picture in his mind.
meanings.sent5: The street signs were all in hangul, guiding them through the city.
